features.featureTitle:
Improve the deterministic career roadmap content so the generated roadmaps are more realistic, career-relevant, and free of irrelevant or misleading technology references.

Specifically update the roadmap template data used by `getRoadmapTemplate(...)` so that:
- Roadmaps do not mention unsupported stack/deployment items (e.g., AWS/Vercel, MongoDB, Node/Express) as required steps unless they are clearly optional and career-appropriate.
- Learning phases, topics, and resources are tailored to the selected career (or at least to its category) and remain consistent with Indian student/fresher context.
- The roadmap output remains fully deterministic (no external API/AI calls) and continues to render via the existing Roadmap UI components without breaking layout.

Add a new ATS-friendly Resume Generator tool as a dedicated tool page/route.

The tool must:
- Be a step-by-step wizard (not a single long form) covering key resume sections: Contact, Summary, Skills (hard + soft), Experience (with action-verb and metrics prompts), Education, Certifications, Projects, and Keywords.
- Generate a clean, ATS-friendly, single-column resume output preview from the collected inputs.
- Provide export options: (1) copy the full resume as plain text to clipboard and (2) download the resume as a .txt file.
- Use clear English for all labels, helper text, and outputs.

Integrate the new ATS Resume Generator into the existing navigation entry points for resume tools.

Add a new tool card in the existing "Resume & Placement Help" section that navigates to the new ATS Resume Generator dedicated page/route (do not open it in the existing modal), while keeping the existing four resume tool cards unchanged and still modal-based.

Add SEO + routing configuration for the ATS Resume Generator page so it participates in the existing SEO system and technical SEO assets.

Update:
- TanStack Router to register the new page route (lazy-loaded like other tool pages).
- `frontend/src/seo/seoRoutes.ts` to include metadata (title, description, keywords, canonicalPath) for the new route.
- `frontend/public/sitemap.xml` to include the new URL so it is discoverable by search engines.

Ensure user-facing SEO strings are in clear English.
